I agree with BlackDuck that you should be able to shoot downwards, or at least shoot slower bullets maybe. The graphics are cute.

description:
An arena shooter, where you must lead your purple guys into battle against the orange guys.
Your shots will turn enemies into explosive slaves. Right click to detonate them.
Arrow keys or WASD to move.
Aim with the mouse.
Left click to fire enslaving ray.
Right click to detonate slaves.
If the purple guys reach the orange guys' spawn position, you win. But there's no game over screen to let you know.
The difficulty was intended to come from attaining high scores. But I didn't get to make a scoring system. The game is pretty much devoid of challenge at the moment.
Made using Unity 2.6 and sfxr.
author: roBurky
title: Purple
comments: Looks pretty good. Gameplay feels nice and would be great with more difficulty and less cheesy weapon.

Even despite the lack of goal, it feels really nice. The movement and graphics are really, really well done, and I like that the sounds are slightly different each time. This could be really cool if you expand it a little further.

I love the way the player and enemies bounce around, and the controls and graphics are neat and simple. It did slow down a bit sometimes, possibly from spawning too many enemies, but once I knew what I was doing it didn't seem too bad. As LastBanana said, the sounds are great, and you could really expand on this idea :)
The game is a really nice start and I would like to see more. My computer could deal with the graphics, but with each bullet being a light (I think) I can see how it could slow down.

Great effort, could easily become a nice game with a few more day's work.  I like the visuals, and the idea works surprisingly well - although I think it might need a more intense, arena-shooter level of chaos to fully shine (it's at its best when lots of enemies are shooting at each other).
dunno if it's just me but rightclicking opens up the context menu of the unity webplayer. (which takes me to the unity site). but still I managed to test the game a little.
well done I like it. would play a bigger version as well.
Hmm. The right click menu should be disabled. What OS and browser are you using, madpew?

Definitely some potential here. Needs some polish, but there are nice effects and an interesting style. It's pretty easy to take out a group by hitting one and immediately right-clicking, but that may be intentional.

I liked the game although I was a bit confused at first because I kept trying to shoot the purple boxes.  The camera needs a bit more acceleration to keep up with you but the player movement is smooth.  What did you do for the enemy pathing?  The swarming is cool.

You're right, the weakness comes from the lack of challenge but I think you should finish this one and post a link here with something that completes your vision because I think you're on a good path.

description:
PIXELSPACE sees you shooting infected green pixels whilst avoiding their attacks.  Guide them into colliding into one another to earn ammunition, and keep your shooting accuracy high to regain health faster.
Official game page: http://www.dcfgames.com/games/pixelspace
author: davecheesefish
title: PIXELSPACE
comments: I found that I really spent a lot more time shooting enemies than using them against each other. I wasn't actually too sure how that worked - sometimes they followed me, and other times not, so it was hard to get them to collide by anything but an accident. Otherwise, it played nice and felt nice. Good job!
Really great game, however i must agree that i spent more time shooting than making them collide. nice work!
Hmm, getting enemies to collide for ammo was more or less pointless, as random collisions would keep me with enough ammo  to last for as long as I wanted.
I would have it so that there is more of an incentive to actually make enemies collide.  Say, bonuses for making enemies cluster nearer to you, or some such.
I really liked the controls!  Really could have used something to change over time to make it get harder. (Better following?  Flocking?)

This was quite a good entry. The game was fun for a few minutes but there wasn't much to do. The graphics were ok, if there had been a bit more variety I would have given you a 3 (perhaps some more sprites, colours, etc. I suggest adding a crosshair mouse cursor).
Also the instructions screen incorrectly said to press A to move backwards instead of S.
kinda slow, hard to get enemies to collide, but it's well done, nice graphics, cool controls (love shooting backwards). gets a little bit boring though.
I felt it actually become easier the longer I was playing. You should make the enemies more threatening I think. Game was good though.

description:
A sidescroller shooter created for the Lundum Dare jam. This is also my first Lundum Dare attempt.
Your task is to defeat the enemies, using their own characteristics against them.
I originally wanted to do something more complicated, but due to my busy schedule, this was all I could do.
More information on the game, including a brief log of events, is within the game itself. Just hit F1.
Created with Game Maker.
author: shawnyu114
title: Minion Swarm

description:
I kind of just wanted to make an entry, but I ended up getting bored kind of bored with it, and I suck with art, you can actually tell about where I started giving up. The controls are arrow keys to move, space to jump, and control to shoot, and escape to switch focus back to the player. The intended hand layout was for your left little finger to be on left control, middle and right finger to rest on z and x, and index finger on space, with the left hand on the arrow keys. Just to clear things up.
Known bugs: Hitting corners at the right angle and speed will cause you to fly really high up.
Source code may require Flash CS4.
author: EmptyFlash
title: Mind Operated Control Device
comments: like the levels, sometimes the physics made the char to jump a lot, mostly when was close to the borders.

I really like the concept of the game. Haven't seen that before. What kills it for me though is that you shoot on ctrl and jump on space. That's not very good controls. Also some sort of continue or life system would have been good since you have to start the whole game over when you die.
I like the fact that you could kill yourself as the enemy! I have to agree on button placement and the funky corner physics. Other than that great job!
Woops, source code: http://www.box.net/shared/rihepyy78v (Requires Flash CS4)
Anyway, thanks for the input guys.
Hah!  I got it to bug out on level 4.  Guy died and it didn't switch me back to my character.  No idea what to do on level 5.
I think something like a simple two-frame walk would have done wonders to round-out the look of the game.

Also, I don't get what the others are griping about... space, control, and starting from the beginning when you die all work fine by me, but I'll admit that it *does* bug me that you have a "click to start" in a two-handed keyboard game.

That was actually pretty fun! I've never quite played a "shooter puzzler" before and had a good time. Obviously the graphics need some help as well as the few issues with the corner physics but a really solid concept that entertained me pretty good.
The collision could use work. It was annoying to have to go right back to the start when I fell through the floor on level 3. Good concept though.

description:
COMES FREE WITH A MENU SCREEN!
You are a brave warrior who has fallen into a robot-infested labyrinth. You have no ammo or any means of destroying the robots.
Maybe you can still figure out a way to survive.
If there's only 1 robot left, you will be able to disable it even without ammo. So the goal is to kill all the robots except 1.
NOW WITH "HARD" OPTION!
The exe version can run on its own. The source version requires:
- Python 2.5.4
- pygame 1.9.1
- (optional) py2exe 0.6.9
To run: main.py ; or MazeShooter.exe
To compile: compile2exe.py
- Yoni
author: Yoni
title: Maze Shooter
comments: Haha, nice maze generation. Funny SFX for win/lose.
also: I just lost the game.

Fun game, I like the sound effects. Might be a little too based in luck though as one time I ended up being able to kill all the enemies just by moving right a bit moving back and moving right again, because they were all nicely lined up.But this probably won't make me mark you down.
Nice game, just didn't enjoy the movement that much, it was "clunky"... allowing for sliding on walls would have improved the game to no end...
The randomness makes it hard sometimes to accomplish the level...
Great adherence to theme, great retro feel. Really great first entry!
ps. I WILL KILL THESE ROBOTS

The idea fits the theme well, and it was pretty well-executed. I would have liked movement to be a bit smoother, however, and I found the mazes were often too difficult to line enemies up in, while other times an entire line of enemies would kill themselves. Great job anyway!

I thought this was kinda difficult. Like others said, it probably depends a lot on your luck with the maze generation. I think it would help if the player was allowed to touch the robots, just not touch bullets.

description:
Controls (and a mildly-humourous backstory) are in the Readme.txt file.
I have now uploaded a Linux version, which is almost the same as the Windows version except with no sound.
The Full Source zip contains all the source files for the code and my custom library and also the sfxr .sfs files for sounds and PDN files for images.
author: Robots from Knife Planet K
title: Killer Knife
comments: This was more like "Enemies throwing weapons".
Haha, this was a "literal" interpretation of the theme enemies as weapons. Clever.
right, i played this thing before judging started, i couldn't compile the damn thing so i decided to use the windows binary in wine
i like the concept of the knives being picked up and throwing and this has a lot of potential especially if you add more powerups
it's too damn slow so kinda lacking in the fun department, it would place higher if it were faster
you actually have enemies throwing weapons at you so you've actually failed to follow the theme properly, sadly
graphics are existant and they work
audio is existant and it works
humour really only goes as far as the title, but it's not bad, i reserve the fabled one-star position for stuff which is truly cringe-worthy
overall worth looking at the knives being picked up and thrown but really needs to be faster
alphas/betas and screenshots are great to have, not a heck of a lot of timeline so it gets 3 stars instead of 4 in the community section

You can use the enemies weapons as weapons, but it's not like you can actually aim, it's more just random and not really something you think about. It could be nice if the only way of killing a robot was to make another robots blade hit it.
At first I thought that I couldn't touch the blades on the ground, which made the game impossible :P Maybe you could fade the color a bit.
All in all I don't really feel in control of the game. I just run randomly around for life/emp.

description: An adventure game where you create equipment out of enemies to find your grandfather's glasses.
author: skalle
title: Grandfather glasses
comments: Liked the style and humor - couldn't really finish it, catching that bunny is hard, and jumping over the spikes is impossible.
Interesting idea. Though I couldn't really figure out what the mouse items did aside from the feet ones. Also, I couldn't seem to catch the rabbit or jump over the pit of spikes either. =(
Well I can see I got a little bit farther in your game than Meep and Daniel ;-) I got to the wolf
I like the idea but an introduction to what the different kinds of items do would do wonders. A life system would also enhance playability.
I fell out of the map :D
still a great idea on the crafting part.

Overall, great work.  Pretty difficult to figure out without the hints: I thought I had to catch a bunny first off and figured I just sucked and almost gave up.  I would have loved to see some animation (eg the main character), an intro (explaining what you need to do) and sounds.  Keep up the good work.  =)
Nice game. The hints are very valuable.
More levels would have been nice. The different equipments are a good basis for more puzzles. Is the hands equipment good for anything?

benjaminum: Currently, the puppets (bunny and rat) don't really do anything. Originally I thought that they would provide attack bonuses and new attacks, but there was too little time to add such. The wolf paws still boost speed/jump a little.

description:
Join Dr. Destruction as he researches to create the ultimate weapons.
The games should be pretty self explanitory.
Know issues:  The pinball game is pretty glitchy, that's what the reset (M+F1) is for.
Any other issues, please leave me a note.
Thanks for playing!
** The source is included in the .zip as the .blend files.
Blender 2.49 to open them.
author: jplur
title: Dr. Destruction and the Weapon that Turns Enemies into More Weapons
comments: couldn't pass minigames, unsure of theme relevance?

Great use of "Play game.exe".  Great intro, no question about that.  Unfortunately, I didn't have the patience to get past the card flipping animations, it was just too slow.  I'd like to be able to just pick the mini-games i want to play.
Thanks, there are only two minigames, so you didn't miss much ;)

Interesting, i haven't seen blenders game engine in use much before. I wish you would have used the character more for the game itself. Also would have been nice to see gameplay features supporting the theme of the compo. Otherwise nice entry as a 48 hour compo game. :)

The intro was cool, that's where you lost me.  The fact that it's completely unrelated to the theme is the least of its problems.  Why are you even making 2 mini games when you only have 48 hours to make one game?
I can see how you've tried to link to the theme (research to make a weapon that turns enemies into weapons), but it seems too contrived and too irrelevant.
The music and card matching game was pretty relaxing, but the game crashed afterwards.
Well done for attempting to use the blender game engine. I've done a lot of (low-poly game) modeling in it, but I'd never try to use it to write the logic.
The animated character beside the mini game definitely helped with the atmosphere, it would have been very static, and very dull without him.
Overall though, it didn't really feel like you'd put much thought into creating a game based upon the theme.

description:
Pick up a star to be able to megaman-load and shoot. Jump on moving guys to pick them up and throw them, r to restart. Jump on walls to gain height.
postcompo fixes:
* Compiled in relase!
* Download is in zip with accompanying html
* Fixed jump on enemy bug, they now take to jumps to pickup
* Your health is now displayed
* Fixed graphics
* One extra heart life
* Made text context-sensitive
* Longer/bigger level
* Updated getting-hurt sound so that it hopefully stands out more
* Fixed get-stuck-in-hole bug that andrew spotted(thanks!). It's now possible to walljump up
* Story: You are a dude in a dark dark land, somewhere there is an exit, escape!
author: sirGustav
title: dudidadala
comments: Interesting so far, I do believe at the start of the game if you fall down you can not get back up again. This was annoying and I had to keep reloading the page until I discovered you could press r to restart.
I fell into the same trap at the beginning too, but later realised you can wall-jump up walls. Just thought I'd point that out for future players!

A fairly literal and obvious take on the theme, but it's clean and quite polished, is very playable. Maybe a little too easy to die, especially with those gun enemies which can hurt you way faster than you can throw something at them!
The graphics are nice and clean, and I like the grins on the walls, although visually it would have been nice to have some more varied colours. Plenty of personality on the player character.
Overall, it's not blow-you-out-of-the-water inventive, but it's polished and works, and it's fun to play, which is commendable in itself :)

A bit too difficult, but somewhat addicting due to quick restart. I kept trying over again to get past the first two turret enemies, and to figure out the charge shot before I died. Ended up too often getting hit by shots that started outside the screen. The various weird background tiles add a strange sense of theme/environment rather than having everything be generic walls and floors. That's good. Wall jump capability wasn't obvious without instructions.
Unless I am mistaken I don't think you can wall jump out if you fall down at the beginning. On both sides of the pit there is an overhang which stops you if you are wall jumping
The game was too fast and the turrets are too overpowered and hard to kill. Nice graphical style though.
Here are a few tips if you think the game is too hard: :)

description:
Made with .NET. Nothing fancy used so should work on almost any .NET runtime.
Rule with Demography instead of Democracy, pitting the unhappy populace against themselves. Done for Ludum Dare 48h contest, but no way I'm going to waste judge's time with this so dumping it to Jam. Still, did it in 48 hours.
Select two hex slots with mouse to swap.
Featuring bare minimum of gameplay, inconsistent and not enough graphics, no sounds, lacking all finishing touches.
No scoring. Can't win, can't lose, can't have fun.
Zip includes source.
author: Pokute
title: Demography
comments: Interesting graphics, but as you mentioned hard to find the game. :-) Tried clicking with mouse and mashing keyboard a little, but not much going on.
Ahh, true. Mouse control is not obvious so added a short blurb into the description.

description:
Attach the bodies of sword-monsters to a giant spinning wheel of death. Survive 8 waves of enemies to win the game.
To attack an enemy, you need to swipe one of your swords at it's rear, several times. When an enemy dies, position one of your wheel's empty spokes onto the rear of the enemy to add it to your arsenal.
Made with Unity, Blender, Sfxr, and GIMP.
author: Acheron
title: Death Wheel
comments: Waves of enemies tended to kill themselves fairly quickly but I loved the ability to make enemies kill themselves on 'corpses' lying around the screen.
Thanks! I like to refer to that as "emergent gameplay" rather than "obvious bug."
Nice one... Kind of hard to sometimes take the enemy from behind (pun intended!) :)
Didn't know you could do 2d stuff with Unity, need to take another look at it... :)

A very interesting idea. I've seen quite a few games where you can attach enemies to yourself as weapons, but using them as swords instead of guns is very unique. So in that respect you've definitely gone one step beyond the competition ;)
I also liked how clean and polished this game was. It was fairly simple, and while not outstanding in the audiovisual department, the graphics and sound were simple and effective.
The only problem is that I found it very hard to get behind the enemies without getting hit several times myself. But apart from that, a neat, simple and polished game that's pretty fun. Nice work ;)
Nice idea, simple but effective graphics!

description:
Move using the WASD keys, suck enemies into your cannon with the space bar and aim and fire with the mouse at other enemies. Once all enemies on screen are defeated (fire an enemy in your gun to defeat it) the level will progress.
You have 5 lives, which can be lost by the player falling off screen or by pressing the reset key. Once a life is lost, the level will return to it's original state. Once all lives are lost, the game is over and the player must start again.
There are 8 levels in total, complete them all for a bonus ending cutscene!
author: Hellfang
title: Crustacean Cannon
comments: I really enjoyed it. The controls took a few tries to understand, but it's actually really fun. I love the whole concept of a bunny vacuuming up crabs. Well done.

vacuum cannons for the win, it's a good, simple concept, although from what i played, i think that's about as far as it goes, although what the hell crabs don't walk on the roof... yeah i think that's innovation
you interpreted the theme the same way i did: pick up and throw - good job
the fact that you can't restart from the same level takes a dip in your fun rating, as it would get incredibly tedious playing the same level over and over again
graphics are quite ms-paint-like but quite good, although that title screen gets you that fifth star
audio is there and it works, that's all that needs to be said
didn't really spot humour in this, so N/A
overall i'd recommend this to anyone provided that it were on a different platform
although there were essentially no alphas / betas you did more screenshots than me, i'd have to say this is about par - i like how you explain how the game works

Overall, I enjoyed it. Sometimes the cannon was buggy that it would fire directly upwards when aiming elsewhere. Or if I accidentally clicked outside and it lost focus, clicking back in the window will waste a crab. =< But that didn't take away too much from the game; great work!
I quite enjoyed this one, the concept interested me, but to point out your flaws is more helpful (if more nasty sounding) than pointing out what you did well.

description:
It's finally done...
Should work in most Windows machines, although I only tested it with Windows 7 (64-bit)... But all the code is pretty straightforward, and I'm using old libraries (FMod, for example)...
It might require DirectX 9.0 (Feb. Update), you can get it at http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=0CEF8180-E94A-4F56-B157-5AB8109CB4F5&displaylang=en
It may also require the Visual Studio redistributables, you can get them at http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=32BC1BEE-A3F9-4C13-9C99-220B62A191EE&displaylang=en or http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=9b2da534-3e03-4391-8a4d-074b9f2bc1bf&displaylang=en
Never sure on which it is, to be honest...
Hope you like it, any comments are appreciated!
author: Covenant
title: Conquest
comments: Wonderful stuff, couldn't drag myself away, really neat twist on the tired tower defense formula.
@sfernald: Forgot to add it, should be visible now...
@mpc174: Thanks! Did you manage to finish it? I have tons of ideas for the game, hopefully I'll get to implement them!
Has the graphics been created during the compo time? I've already seen it somewhere ... am i wrong?

More or less, samel... I've traced over some of Oryx's 8x8 sprites he created for the TIGSource Assemblee competition, and added animations to them. Tracing is allowed on the rules, I just copied pixel by pixel each one (that's why I chose the 8x8 pixel images, easy to copy).
You added animation to that WONDERFUL sprites? GREAT!!! Cant wait to see them
Well, I moved the feet a pixel to the middle for the walk cycle... :P Not much can be done with my graphic skills... :)
Love the multiple units and unique game play. Awesome.

This game suffers from a pretty major bug and strategy flaw. There are occasionally invisible gems that drop. I realized this when I saw units moving "under" the grass tile, but never through that tile. Then I discovered that they will never pass though a gem, invisible or not. So by not collecting gems you actually have the option to block everyone off and just wait them out. Too easy.
Suggestion, gems from fallen enemies are dropped to some sort of inventory on the bottom of the screen. Keep the board clear.

Hum, Cymon, that's actually a very good suggestion... The gems being on the battlefield was just an idea to strategize a bit (i.e. block enemies by killing enemies on a narrow place, and only use that gem if you're really in a pickle).

The invisible gems bug is very weird... It seems to me that it's not invisible at all, but it has selected an invalid gem and the image that appears is the grass tile (that would make it impossible to grab aswell)...
I'll take a look at it when I review the game... Got 4 pages of my notebook full of ideas of stuff that would be cool...
But really like the inventory thing, could be expanded to lots of cool stuff... :)
A cute idea, but too slow-paced and seems to crash after fourth level or so.
Great fun. I like the cutscenes.
Good, solid gameplay. Sometimes seemed a bit slow though.
Was afraid of doing it too fast, to be honest... my last entries in the LD all suffered because of being too hard... :)
love the graphics, and the mechanics. well done. will play this again.
Very cool idea, and I enjoyed the cut scenes a lot.
I found it very easy to win through leaving the fallen gems out, but I still played through to the end because I wanted to see the twist! Good fun.

description:
It doesn't really follow the theme but whatever.
The scores are messed up, but I'm out of time.
Hope you like it! :-)
author: frusen
title: Bugger
comments: Hey Luke, yeah, didn't see much the theme, lol but good ol' frogger is always nice.
Solid frogger clone, nice - just the right difficulty too, I've played way too many frogger clones that were too hard.
Well yeah, doesn't have much to do with the theme, but the result is solid.
Hm, it seems ctrl does nothing at all, also not sure about the point of shooting since it only makes things more difficult!
Otherwise, it's mostly working (under Linux). I just had a problem when I jumped on a trunk and the game showed the red cross as if I had jumped in the water, but I didn't.

description:
I typically make non-violent games, so getting a theme like this threw me initially.  I did find a concept that I liked in the end, and I'm really quite happy with how it all came together, I hope you like it.
Edit: I've put up a playthrough video for anyone that might be having problems getting back out.  It's spoilerific though: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=meKITP12Dsc
author: Jonathan Whiting
title: Collateral
comments: thanks for the fun, love games with no life counting :) u just play and play ... really like it, btw how to get out after you get the nuclear artifact ? :)

I just started to play people's entries- it looks to be a good crop so far! I'm impressed by how densely this is designed, and how each area works in multiple ways. It's also pretty complete feeling. it seems like you did a good job of choosing an appropriate scope and pacing yourself (I wish I'd had the sense to do similarly!) I really enjoyed the game, and played through until I got stuck here (spoilers) http://img594.imageshack.us/img594/907/ss20100822204245.png
Nice little game. I'm going to play through and try pacifism this time.
I couldn't get back out! But I had a lot of fun getting down! Extremely well done!
i'm stuck at the same bit as Sparky! *keeps trying*
oops, posted to quickly. i figured it out 2 seconds later. :D  seriously great game.
Ah, I liked this : ) It took me a while to get used to the mechanics, but I managed to get to the top without too many frustrations.

Awesome fun, simple/clean style that works really well. Maybe a solution to the trouble people were having returning to the surface (I too got stuck here) would be to have a section early on at the top which requires you to "laser jump?" to progress? introducing that mechanic earlier in some way may avoid people falling into that problem. I want more levels! :D

This is honestly my favourite Ludum Dare game to date. Wonderful concept and plenty of clever level design. I do look forward to giving pacifism a chance, although I suspect that'll be incredibly hard and frustrating - haha! Very well done.
It's something of an inspiration for future LDs for me as well, to nail down the basic art and mechanics completely on day one to allow for level design. It demonstrates how that extra time pays off.
Lovely game structure, and the gameplay mechanic is neat.
Didn't have a problem with the difficulty level.
Nice little game with an added bit of humor in the middle of it. =P Makes me want a longer version of it.
couldn't make the way up again (got stuck in the middle) but I like this game. well done.
This is a great game! The whole thing was very well put together and did not feel rushed at all. I love your take on the theme.
This is my favourite submission of the ones I have played so far. Extremely well done!
SOOOOOO GOOD. Funny, innovative, purdy, and DANG FUN.
This is one of the best LD entries I've ever played.
A lot of fun, but was really quite hard not to kill people on the way up. I liked how weapons fire became extra useful there.

Definitely one of the best entries I have tried so far! I managed to get all the way through the game. Graphics and audio weren't great, but were very polished. Didn't really fit the theme, but the theme is overrated anyway.

Would be good to have some in-game documentation about pressing Z to go through the cutscene dialogue and the [spoiler] mechanic that people seem to be having trouble with (I found it by pure luck). Also, some better sound effects and voice acting for the cutscenes would be awesome.
Going back up was more fun than going down! I did get frustrated trying to get up the area with lots of single floating blocks though.
At one point a high-pitched sound kept playing over and over again, so I had to turn off the sound effects.

description:
Battle puzzle is a simple game where you head for the goal.
Arrow keys control the character.
Space switches between blue and orange color which allow you to go through projectiles of the same color.
F2 restarts the game.
I had very little time during this weekend but still wanted to make something, so here's my 5 hour production made using XNA.
author: Dzarg
title: Battle Puzzle
comments: Ooh, an Ikaruga-style bullet-phasing game where enemies hit each other. Nice. Not enough to play though.

I did a very similar concept, so maybe I'm biased, but I liked this. Also you've done it in XNA which was probably non trivial. Nice effort but would like to see more levels and some sound. Also I cracked up laughing the first time I got flung around by an enemy :D
What DLLs do I need to play XNA games?  They never work for me on Windows 7 64
Installed XNA Framework redist 3.1 and still can't run, sadly.
Windows is checking for a solution to the problem..."
I'd like to try this (it's on my rating list) but XNA... Meh.

description:
As I submit this, there are still 20 hours left to the competition, but I just don't think I'll be able to do any work nor upload it tomorrow. If I do, I'll be sure to add sounds and maybe some other weapons before the deadline. There currently is about 12 actual hours of work in this. As usual, wish I had more free time the weekend. Probably be taking off for the next LD.
I decided to take the theme quite litteraly. As such, the enemies are the weapons. Like, litteraly. They're weapons. And they're shooting at you. Thing is, you are a weapon too! Shoot back at em using the mouse. Move with WASD. Action (swap weapons, go down stairs) with spacebar. The goal is to get to the very bottom of the bottomless dungeon. Find the stairs on each randomly generated level to the next!
author: xeon06
title: Attack Of The Weapons
comments: When I try to run the exe it says "Unable to find a version of the runtime to run this application." I assume that means I need one of the .NET Frameworks, but I don't know which.
Would have been very nice to have a standalone that didn't need me to install .NET.

Didn't think the theme was covered in a very interesting way, though it was within the interpretation. Random levels, however is a boon, though didn't slog through a lot of them to see how different they actually were.
Not bad, great take on the theme :)
At first I thought, "not another 'weapons as enemies' game", but I guess you kinda had it both ways. Not sure the game was that interesting, but the gun graphics are nice.
Grr at .NET dependencies. But an amusing take on the theme, nonetheless.
It'd be nice if you posted a link to the dependencies... :)

description:
Alien Super Mega Blaster (named by my son) is a take on Space Invaders.
The theme is incorporated by the fact aliens do not fire back, but attack in response to you firing on them and spraying shrapnel in attempt to kill you.  This shrapnel also kills the aliens and you can get a score multiplier for a cascade death by knocking out one of the large ships.
Some bugs for sure and would certainly like to improve the collision detection as this has been implemented for time to code.  Pixel perfect will certainly be on the cards.
To run this you will need either the XNA studio 3.1 or the XNA redist from the link below:
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=53867A2A-E249-4560-8011-98EB3E799EF2&displaylang=en
If running this game is not possible as you either do not want to or can not install XNA, then I have updated a video of the submitted version here:
http://tinyurl.com/2639hyw
Have fun and would love some feedback.
author: Codheadz
title: Alien Super Mega Blaster
comments: Adding additional gameplay element would have helped a lot for sustaining interest, though.

Thanks for playing Pokute.  Certainly could do with more game play elements, but had very limited time.  Kept a backlog of things to develop and was strick in starting the next addition until I had finished what I was working on.
Love the graphic style! The shrapnel is really well done. Strays a LITTLE bit from the theme, but maybe more of that should have happened during this compo.
A little more randomness would have helped - or at least some kind of fighting back of the aliens. As it is, the aliens are very passive and do not pose a threat once the concept is understood.
Unfortunately I couldnt run this, although I did get the idea from the video. I gave 2 for innovation due to the schrapanel mechanic. An interesting if indirect take on the theme.
I love the graphics; I might consider a similar style next LD :P 3 stars for that.
Nice graphical style and the game was fun to play. It was cool that with a well placed shot onto one of the flying saucers at the top you could take a massive chunk out of the enemy ranks. :D

description:
Update: Now works on all windows versions without compatibility mode hopefully. There was a problem with the PySFML 1.6 download for windows, compiled it from source and the game should work now.
A puzzle game, featuring zombies. Don't let anybody escape to the safehouses. With two enemy types.
Shambler: your basic human enemy, as soon as they can hear a zombie within 3 tiles of them they start to move towards the nearest safehouse. If they get there then you fail in your mission.
Sniper: trained soldiers, although they can kill your zombies, you can get back at them, as years of sitting around waiting for something to happen have removed their ability to turn 180 degrees, so if you can get behind them then you can transform them easily and when they are on your side, you can use their rifle to kill far away enemies.
The zombies in this game were caused by some mysterious magical force, they can resurrect the dead corpses of slain humans. A dead zombie however, remains dead.
Controls:
*  left click on a zombie to select it
*  right click on a tile to path towards it
*  press the spacebar or end turn button to advance 1 turn
*  as a sniper, right click on an enemy to shoot.
*  press R to restart the level if you get stuck
Only managed to finish making three levels in the end, but probably will add more in a post compo version. When you get past the third level you will just get a plain level with one enemy in the corner. There are level creation tools built in but they are not particularly well designed. Read below for info on how to use them.
Really enjoyed this competition and hope to take part in future ludum dares.
Here is how to create your own level:
* Press E to enter the tile editor. Press one to use wall tiles and press zero to use floor tiles, click to paint
* Press C to enter the collision editor, paint over the walls by clicking on them to make them colidable.
* Press H to enter the entity placement editor, press 0 to place shamblers, 1 to place safehouses and 2 to place snipers. With shamblers and snipers, left click gets you a zombie and left click and shift gets you a sniper. After using the entity placement editor press R as this restarts the level and makes sure your entities will show up when you play.
* Press P to play.
* To save the level, press S.
* If you need to skip forward to your level when you start up the game U skips forwards one level.
author: Andrew Marsh
title: Zombie Conquest
comments: I could only start the game once.
And ran into the safe house and lost.
Seems ok, but takes a bit long with the rounds.
One easy start/tutorial level that is fast to play had been nice.
Ok the start once was my fault...
Chickenwing, could you try running it in compatablity mode for windows 98, for some reason the game crashes randomly on Windows Vista and Windows 7 if you do not do this.

And about tutorial levels. Yeah I think that is a good idea, I might add some more levels and actual in game instructions later, I don't know what the competition rules are regarding extra levels are but I could definately add some for the jam. It was difficult to judge the difficulty of the levels I was making.
Also, about it taking a long time. You can keep moving forward turns by holding in the spacebar.
Not very intuitive but I liked the idea.
Not a bad idea, but I simply couldn't get past the first level... is there some sort of magic strategy that I'm completely missing?

It is possible, remember that snipers can shoot in a straight line in a direction, and that you can turn a dead human into a zombie by moving up to them. Work out the quickest way of getting a sniper to a place where they can shoot the human, right click on the human and you should get it. Sorry if the levels are impossible to work out. I have had no playtesting except for my own, and seeing as I already knew the solutions I couldn't really judge difficulty.
Couldn't run it even in compatibility mode (Windows 7 64-bit here)
Tried it, it works now... Thanks!
Neat little puzzler, especially since you included an editor.
I had to use XP/SP3 compatibility mode (Win7x64) but then it seemed fine.
It's too bad you didn't have time to make more levels.  I liked where this was going!

description:
Use the enemies abilities to have them kill each other.
(Updated with the correct download link)
Program used - Construct http://www.scirra.com/
Sounds - From SFXR
Over twelve hours of work.
P.S I hate Springs... and you should too...
author: E
title: Weapon
comments: The chargers and the fire's were decently fun. I didn't know what to do against the spring though.
You have some interesting enemies, but as it is right now, I'd call your entry more of an enemy showcase than a game.

Okay, I hate springs too.   The sound gets grating after a while, and it's just annoying to deal with the springs.   I did get to level 6 briefly.   I couldn't bare trying to get rid of the spring for a third time.   The concept could be fun, but in this state it's not.. The graphics are serviceable.
Not really sure what to do in the third level. I played around with the spring guy for a while but never worked out what I was supposed to do. I went to the door and it did nothing.
A decent attempt, and maybe the enemies get more interesting after a while, but unfortunately I've not been able to experience them :(
Aarrgh, springs!! Eventually got rid of the one on level 3, but was too frustrated by then to get past level 4...

description:
Mixing colors by shooting your color gun through your colored enemies!
Also my first Ludum Dare entry :)
There are no tutorial levels, so i strongly recommend that you read the guide and or watch these videos:
www.zigs.dk/resources/files/unity/Undertone%20Continuum/Controls%20and%20goal.txt
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1vLyhvF4QBQ - gameplay video part 1
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KPt8sLloC_w - gameplay video part 2
author: zigs
title: Undertone Continuum
comments: nive game ! just made me dizzy with the camera so close to the ground :P

yeah, it feels close cause everything is so damn big.. I realized that thinks would have to be big so that you could see them from afar.. and then i later figured that uppering the speed would make it much more fun.. so now it looks like you're flying along the ground, zoom! dooh. :D

For some reason the mouse wasn't locking to the screen's centre, so I found it really difficult to aim around. I also found the controls a bit awkward. I think it was a neat idea, and it seemed to work pretty well, but it just got so complicated with all of those factors that I couldn't really play it.

Great job!  The camera was indeed too low, and without reading the text file I never would have figured it out at all: counterintuitive.  Also, the mouse cursor should go away as I kept aiming where the mouse icon was rather than where the reticle was.  All it needs is polish, and a screen that explains how to shoot, etc.  Overall, good job - I like the idea of the colour mixing.

Interesting concept but it is too tough for me to really manage all the variables and controls as is to have much fun. I enjoyed the strange creatures that stream at you and eventually figured out how to make some other colors by shooting through other enemies.
TheLastBanana and Breakdance McFunkypants: Yeah, I have no idea why i never removed the mouse. I kinda didnt care while developing it.. and then it kinda slipped my mind.. damnit.
as for the difficulity problems: Yes, i know :( Well, I was gonna make a tutorial level.. but ran out of time. yeey..
The mouse is not grabbed when running it in wine. (Happens with all unity games that grab the mouse).
by the way; Thanks for all the kind words :)
I had huge performance problems with this one once the cute droplet guys showed up.
hmm, yes. there IS something going on with the performance. it's probably something stupid that i haven't noticed :P
if you play the win/mac build it should run much faster than the web build though :)

The colour mixing is a very interesting concept and I think it has potential! The game was also quite atmospheric in the sense that I felt like I was in some weird anime movie - great job on getting such a good looking entry done in the short time-frame!

Unfortunately, I have to agree that the game was quite counterintuitive and hard to pick up and play. It seems largely down to luck whether you can get the right colour droplet, near the right colour walker in such a direction that you can line it up for a shot - so that drains the fun quite a bit.

For me it would've felt better suited to the theme to maybe rather use a mechanic where you eat the droplets to mix up a colour - then fire that colour with a left click of the mouse (clearing you're palette again so you shoot white): gather up the right types of enemies then use them to kill one of the big hitters. That way you would HAVE to use your enemies to damage any enemies other than white ones (where currently you can kill around 30-50% without using enemies). This could also greatly simplify your control scheme from wasd + 4 keys to: wasd + lmb shoot + rmb zooms.
Mwest: thanks for the kind words and the colour idea, i really like it. in fact, i think i'm gonna do that and make the firing through enemies an option for special times.
Counter intuitive seems to be my trademark; i should start Counter Intuitive Studios or something.. CIS.

description:
My first Ludum Dare entry! Things did not go according to plan. It's somewhat glitchy.
However, this is the only entry where you can ride an explosive Rhino Rabbit. *Twice.* How can you refuse such an offer?
X to jump. Z to slash.
Slash at enemies to make them collide and explode.
Some enemies may be used as platforms.
Press R to restart the level if things glitch out too badly.
author: JamesGecko
title: This End Up
comments: That was pretty fun. I think it needs to be a more forgiving though (or at least have an easier difficulty).
-Allow the player to take more than one hit (have health).
-Make attacks on enemies right next to you more successful.
-When an enemy gets up after being attacked, it shouldn't start moving at full speed right away.
-Variable jump height? (by holding the jump key less long)
-Respawn vital enemies (ones needed to activate platforms, etc)
I liked the rhinos. They kept getting away from me though :-(

description: Use your mouse to move Rubberman around to deflect the insults hurled toward the innocent critters right back at them! Make it through all three levels to make it to the safety of the castle.
author: CataclysmicKnight
title: The Adventures of Rubberman!
comments: Not bad!  The art is cute and the gameplay seems pretty polished.
The bouncing back was a little buggy, as sometimes it didn't appear to actually respond to getting hit, but most of the time it was good.
I wasn't sure if I could hit the innocents, since they are spiky--I was afraid Rubberman was going to get caught on them.

description:
Make sure to keep the compliments and to send back those hurtful words! Reject the insults!
Background: I'm visiting a friend this weekend and don't have access to most of my tools (e.g. tablet, scanner and alone time).  I did, however, want to compete in some shape or form.  I woke up early Saturday morning and coded this for kicks.
author: alexandersshen
title: Rubber and Glue
comments: Ha! That was pretty funny! I enjoyed it a lot, nicely done :)
My only complaint is that the randomness seems a bit "too" random, I ran into I think 20 douche's in row. Seems people hate me lol
Not bad.  Very cleanly done for a quick job.  I ended up just sorting the words by color, but perhaps that's what you intended?  Also, more words would be nice.
I really like your take on the theme. =P Was very well made for something very simple.
Nice idea!  It works surprisingly well as a mechanic.  Good work!

Quick and simple. The sounds (sounds like sfxr?) fit the game well, and the gameplay mechanic was easy to get started with. Having a "hard" mode where all the words are the same color would add a little variety. Nice job!
I agree with jakkarth. Fun game, but I was waiting for it to switch colors on me. Would make it more challenging and would be so simple to do. As it is, it is kind of a color recognition test.
This is OK.  The graphics are nice, and it's pretty refined.   I could see this doing well on some free game site for a short time,  if the vocabulary was expanded a bit. :)
I totally forgot to include the source code! Just uploaded.
I dont have many opinions on this really. I found that it wasnt so much a game as a test of reflexes. I wasnt reading the words, just using the colour to decide.
There were no enemies! Only their words. This could have been done as a turn based fighting thing, FF style. That would have given it more depth.
It would be awesome with synthesised (or recorded) speech, though I recon the insults would be funnier in a computer voice. :D

description:
Partially finished game done by two guys.
One who can draw, another who can program.
However, the programmer decided to use Flixel and start programming AS3 for the first weekend in his life.
We have much more artwork done, but underestimated how hard it would be to animate it.
The game was meant to be a side-scroller beat-em-up where you took the fallen body parts of other robots and attached them to yourself.
The Screenshots show some un-implemented artwork.
author: tylo
title: Robot Time

description: I was going to make a rogue-like for this Ludum Dare, but external forces cut into my time majorly, so I scraped all my work on it, and decided instead to work on a new Engine to handle rogue-like / RTS / other games in 3D.   It's not very exciting right now, but hopefully in a month or two it will be usable, and by December Ludum Dare, it will be in a usable state.
author: TenjouUtena
title: Revolution Engine

description:
Introduction
------------
In PSI keepers you control a special PSI powered unit with the arrow keys
(or WASD). There will be many suicide bombers trying to run into you and
kill you. Move out of their way and target them with the mouse. Once
targeted, press and hold the left mouse button down to assume control of
one of the bombers. The bomber moves to where the mouse cursor is, so
move the bomber against another bomber, so they both explode. Try to
survive as long as possible
Requirements
------------
Windows XP/Vista/7
.NET Framework 3.5
Credits
-------
Done by Jere "XMunkki" Sanisalo

DrPetter's 'sfxr' utility was used to create the sound files.
